presentation.fsa
Class BezierEdgePlacer

java.lang.Object
  presentation.fsa.BezierEdgePlacer

public class BezierEdgePlacer
extends Object

Algorithms for laying out a Bezier edge among a set of existing edges connecting the same pair of nodes. FIXME In some cases, the placed edge increases its arc one more time than required.

Author:
Helen Bretzke for DES Lab, Dept of ECE, Queen's University, Kingston 13 August 2006

Constructor Detail

public BezierEdgePlacer()
Method Detail

insertEdgeAmong

public static void insertEdgeAmong(BezierEdge edge,
                                   Set<Edge> otherEdges)
Inserts edge among the given set of other edges, where all edges connect the same pair of nodes. Computes the layouts for each edge such that they are distributed comfortably along the circumferences of each end node. TODO change this algorithm so that it accommodates reflexive edges and initial arrows (adjacent on only one of edge's end nodes).

Parameters:
edge - the edge to be inserted
otherEdges - set of all other edges connecting the same pair of nodes

tooClose

public static boolean tooClose(Edge edge1,
                               Set<Edge> edges)
Returns true iff the one or more endpoints of edge1 is within a distance threshold of any of the endpoints of an edge in edges TODO find a nice-looking minimum comfortable distance between endpoints to allow margins for arrow head along node boundary or add a parameter to this method. Precondition: edge and edges are non-null

Parameters:
edge1 - the edge to be placed
edges - the set of edges
Returns:
true iff the one or more endpoints of edge1 is within a distance threshold of any of the endpoints of an edge in edges
